CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 10, 1953, pg. 2, reads: "JUDGE DREW AWARDS GPIL A CHARTER - The Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League marked another milestone in its history here Friday, Oct. 2., when Judge Drew awarded them their state charter, making them a legally chartered organization, doing business in state, city and county. Present at the ceremony were executive board members and the group's attorney.  Left to right: De. Elmer B. Harrison, vice president; Manford Sales, president; Dr. L. F. Davis, education chairman; Judge Drews of Common Pleas Court; Atty. Henry R. Smith, legal adviser, and James McCoy Jr., employment chairman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Elmer B. Harrison, Manford Sales, L. F. Davis, Judge John Drews shaking Sales' hand, Henry Smith, and James McCoy Jr., posed in interior, possibly courtroom, with wood paneling
